messages.text:
Hello r@golang.org, adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode360 doc/go1.1.html:360: openbsd/386 and openbsd/amd64 platforms. An ARMv6 newline after sentence. https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode361 doc/go1.1.html:361: or better processor is required for freebsd/arm or "better"? do you mean "later"? https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode362 doc/go1.1.html:362: netbsd/arm platforms. i think you can drop 'platforms' here - it's clear.

https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode361 doc/go1.1.html:361: or better processor is required for freebsd/arm or On 2013/04/02 13:52:19, r wrote: > "better"? do you mean "later"? i think "ARMv6 or better" is ok here. we could also say this to be more specific: ARMv6 (ARM11) or ARMv7 (Cortex-A series).

I think an amd64 is better than an arm, but that's not what you're
trying to say, so let's be clear. Your rewrite is fine.

-rob

Thank you for your comments. I'm sorry such a simple documentation exercise has consumed so much of everyone's time. https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html File doc/go1.1.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode360 doc/go1.1.html:360: openbsd/386 and openbsd/amd64 platforms. An ARMv6 On 2013/04/02 13:52:19, r wrote: > newline after sentence. Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode361 doc/go1.1.html:361: or better processor is required for freebsd/arm or On 2013/04/02 13:58:54, minux wrote: > On 2013/04/02 13:52:19, r wrote: > > "better"? do you mean "later"? > i think "ARMv6 or better" is ok here. I went with "later", ARMv7 cores were designed after ARMv6, and it sidesteps any pedantic discussions of which is better. > we could also say this to be more specific: > ARMv6 (ARM11) or ARMv7 (Cortex-A series). This is the kind of detail I was hoping to exclude. https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043/diff/5001/doc/go1.1.html#newcode362 doc/go1.1.html:362: netbsd/arm platforms. On 2013/04/02 13:52:19, r wrote: > i think you can drop 'platforms' here - it's clear. Done.

Hello r@golang.org, adg@golang.org, minux.ma@gmail.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=cfe93dfc5788 ***

doc/go1.1.html: additional tweaks

R=r, adg, minux.ma
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/8250043
